context: From childhood, Gaddafi was aware of the involvement of European colonialists in Libya; <a9_0>his nation was occupied by <a10_0>Italy<a10_0/><a9_0/>, and during the North African Campaign of World War II it witnessed conflict between Italian and <a11_0>British<a11_0/> troops. <a5_0>According to later claims, <a4_0>Gaddafi's paternal grandfather, <a12_0>Abdessalam Bouminyar<a12_0/>, was killed by the Italian Army during the Italian invasion of <a13_0>1911<a13_0/><a5_0/><a4_0/>. At World War II's end in 1945, <a6_0>Libya was occupied by <a2_0>British and <a14_0>French<a14_0/> forces<a6_0/><a2_0/>. Although Britain and France intended on dividing the nation between their empires, the General Assembly of the United Nations (UN) declared that the country be granted political independence. <a0_0><a7_0>In 1951<a0_0/>, the UN created the United Kingdom of Libya, a federal state under the leadership<a7_0/> of <a3_0><a8_0>a pro-western monarch, Idris<a3_0/>, who banned political parties and established <a1_0>an absolute monarchy<a1_0/>.
